learning_outcomes.description: Understand and articulate the theoretical basis of common molecular biological techniques.
Competently carry out common techniques in the laboratory.
Describe and apply the principles of basic experimental design.
Apply and describe practices that demonstrate scientific ethics.
Collect, interpret and report molecular biological data.
Present findings in common forms of scientific communication.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment will be on the basis of how well each student attains the objectives of each practical session.

The students will be asked questions by the lab demonstrator in every practical class. The students answer the questions orally, in class.

Attendance and active participation in all practical classes is compulsory. See Additional Information for information on absence from practical sessions.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will be asked questions by the lab demonstrator in every practical class. The students answer the questions orally, in class.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess material covered in the first 5 weeks of the course. Further information on the exam format and conditions will be provided in lectures prior to the exam, and on the course website.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Paper/ Report/ Annotation
assessments.task_description:
Detailed instructions on how to complete this task are detailed on the course Blackboard site. Briefly, you will need to read and understand some material about a kit produced by a molecular biology company, and then produce a short flyer and video explaining what the kit does and how it does it.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written and video submissions independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment item requires the submission of two files.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will predominantly assess material covered in weeks 6-13 but will build on material covered in the first 5 weeks of the course. Further information on the exam format and conditions will be provided in lectures prior to the exam, and on the course Blackboard site.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

Lectures

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Practical sessions

You will be allocated to a morning (10:00-1:00) on Mondays and Tuesdays OR afternoon group (2:00-5:00) on Tuesdays. If enrolments are small only Tuesday sessions will be run.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L05
